CatDescriptText: Betty Purter, housewife, Hill District was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 20, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe in the old-fashioned "woodshed" reprimand or the "talking things over with the offender" type of discipline as regards the correction of youngsters guilty of misdemeanors?" Answer reads: 'Talking it over is better."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Betty Purter wearing light colored coat with fur collar, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of man wearing dark zippered jacket with dark collar, dark cap, and light colored scarf, standing in front of building
